subject: Re: [junit] test collector for junit under ant?
msgSnippet: ... I like keeping test classes separate from production classes, so that I don t have to rely on a naming convention. You might try GSBase s
messageBody:
>So said George Dinwiddie on 2003-07-21 --------------------
>What's the "best practice" for collecting junit tests and running them
>within an ant build? I definitely don't want to hand-create a suite,
>and I'd prefer to not have to depend on a naming convention. Is there
>an easy means to pick up all the tests in a particular source tree? Or
>compile the test source to a different classes directory and pick up the
>tests there? What are people using for this?

I like keeping test classes separate from production classes, so that I don't have to rely on a naming convention.

You might try GSBase's RecursiveTestSuite which allows you to scan the file system for tests, then use a TestFilter to choose the ones you want to execute. This is not an Ant-based solution.

Take care.
